title: Risk management system for high-risk AI systems

article_refs.quote: A risk management system shall be established, implemented, documented and maintained in relation to high-risk AI systems.

legal_consequence.verbatim: A risk management system shall be established, implemented, documented and maintained in relation to high-risk AI systems.

items.label: Scope and iteration (paragraphs 2–9)
items.text: Risk management is continuous over the lifecycle, includes identification, evaluation and mitigation of risks, testing (including potentially in real-world conditions), and considers residual risk acceptability.

items.label: Penalty and enforcement (Article 99)
items.text: Obligation/requirement. Administrative fines up to EUR 15,000,000 or 3% of worldwide turnover (whichever is higher) may apply for non‑compliance (subject to SME caps and due process).

question.prompt: Does Article 2 scope apply (and no exclusion)?
Is the actor a provider per Art. 3(2)?
Is the AI system high-risk under Art. 6?
